00022 /*
00023 >>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>
00024 
00025 The PLIER (Probe Logarithmic Error Intensity Estimate) method produces
00026 an improved signal by accounting for experimentally observed patterns 
00027 in probe behavior and handling error at the appropriately at low and 
00028 high signal values.
00029 
00030 >>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>
00031 */
00032 
00033 #ifndef _AFFX_HEAP_SORT_
00034 #define _AFFX_HEAP_SORT_
00035 
00036 //////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
00037 
00038 inline long LeftChild(long a)
00039 {
00040         return(2*a+1);
00041 }
00042 
00043 //////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
00044 
00045 inline long RightChild(long a)
00046 {
00047         return(2*a+2);
00048 }
00049 
00050 //////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
00051 
00052 inline void Heap(double *Vector, long *TieBreaker, long *Rank, long ListSize, long start)
00053 {
00054         long notdone;
00055         long left, right, largest, current;
00056         long tmprank;
00057         // object at start has been put on the appropriate subheap
00058         // propagate it down the heap as required
00059         current = start;
00060         notdone = 1;
00061         largest = current;
00062         while (notdone)
00063         {
00064                 left = LeftChild(current);
00065                 if (left<ListSize)
00066                 {
00067                         if (Vector[Rank[largest]]<Vector[Rank[left]])
00068                                 largest = left;
00069                 }
00070 
00071                 right = RightChild(current);
00072 
00073                 if (right<ListSize)
00074                 {
00075                         if (Vector[Rank[largest]]<Vector[Rank[right]])
00076                                 largest = right;
00077                 }
00078 
00079                 if (largest==current)
00080                         notdone = 0; // stop now with heap property
00081                 else
00082                 {
00083                         tmprank = Rank[current];
00084                         Rank[current] = Rank[largest];
00085                         Rank[largest] = tmprank;
00086                         current = largest; // just swapped into this position
00087                 }
00088         }
00089 }
00090 
00091 //////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
00092 
00093 inline void HeapIndex(double *Vector, long *TieBreaker, long *Rank, long ListSize)
00094 {
00095         long i;
00096         long tmprank;
00097         // provides a rank vector to go with an array by using heapsort
00098         // all vectors must be allocated beforehand
00099         for (i=0; i<ListSize; i++)
00100                 Rank[i] = i; // put pointer to Vector
00101         // now sort
00102         for (i=ListSize/2; i>-1; i--)
00103                 Heap(Vector, TieBreaker, Rank, ListSize, i); // do a heap-building operation
00104         for (i=ListSize-1; i>-1; i--)
00105         {
00106                 tmprank = Rank[i]; // sort index
00107                 Rank[i] = Rank[0]; // pop off heap to current end of list
00108                 Rank[0] = tmprank; // put element at top of heap
00109                 Heap(Vector, TieBreaker, Rank, i, 0); // build heap again
00110         }
00111 }
00112 
00113 //////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
00114 
00115 inline int CompareV(double *VA, double *VB, long VLength)
00116 {
00117         long i;
00118         // Vlength entries
00119         for (i=0; i<VLength; i++)
00120         {
00121                 if (VA[i]<VB[i])
00122                         return(1);
00123                 if (VA[i]>VB[i])
00124                         return(0);
00125                 // if equal, try the next one in line
00126         }
00127         return(0); // not less than, all mysteriously equal!
00128 }
00129 
00130 //////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
00131 
00132 inline void HeapMatrix(double **Vector, long *Rank, long ListSize, long VLength, long start)
00133 {
00134 static  long notdone;
00135 static  long left, right, largest, current;
00136 static  long tmprank;
00137         // object at start has been put on the appropriate subheap
00138         // propagate it down the heap as required
00139         current = start;
00140         notdone = 1;
00141         largest = current;
00142         while (notdone)
00143         {
00144                 left = LeftChild(current);
00145 
00146                 if (left<ListSize)
00147                 {
00148                         if (CompareV(Vector[Rank[largest]],Vector[Rank[left]], VLength))
00149                                 largest = left;
00150                 }
00151 
00152                 right = RightChild(current);
00153 
00154                 if (right<ListSize)
00155                 {
00156                         if (CompareV(Vector[Rank[largest]],Vector[Rank[right]], VLength))
00157                                 largest = right;
00158                 }
00159 
00160                 if (largest==current)
00161                         notdone = 0; // stop now with heap property
00162                 else
00163                 {
00164                         tmprank = Rank[current];
00165                         Rank[current] = Rank[largest];
00166                         Rank[largest] = tmprank;
00167                         current = largest; // just swapped into this position
00168                 }
00169         }
00170 }
00171 
00172 //////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
00173 
00174 inline int HeapIndexMatrix(double **Matrix, long *Rank, long ListSize, long VLength)
00175 {
00176 static  long i;
00177 static  long tmprank;
00178         // provides a rank vector to go with an array by using heapsort
00179         // all vectors must be allocated beforehand
00180         for (i=0; i<ListSize; i++)
00181                 Rank[i] = i; // put pointer to entries in Matrix
00182         // now sort
00183         for (i=ListSize/2; i>-1; i--)
00184                 HeapMatrix(Matrix, Rank, ListSize, VLength, i); // do a heap-building operation
00185         for (i=ListSize-1; i>-1; i--)
00186         {
00187                 tmprank = Rank[i]; // sort index
00188                 Rank[i] = Rank[0]; // pop off heap to current end of list
00189                 Rank[0] = tmprank; // put element at top of heap
00190                 HeapMatrix(Matrix, Rank, i, VLength, 0); // build heap again
00191         }
00192         return(1);
00193 }
